intro: Antimima eendornensis, commonly known as the Eendorn antimima, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It has a short stature, often growing as a shrub with woody stems and hairy leaves. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Antimima eendornensis is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
